text: Rafael Nadal defended the 2009 title by defeating his compatriot Fernando Verdasco 6–0, 6–1 to break an 11-month title drought, and to win a historic 6th consecutive title in Monte-Carlo. He dropped a mere 14 games throughout the entire tournament. ==Seeds== The top eight seeds receive a bye into the second round. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ====Section 1==== ====Section 2==== ===Bottom Half=== ====Section 3==== ====Section 4==== ==References== *Main Draw *Qualifying Draw Singles
title: 2010 Monte-Carlo Rolex Masters – Singles
